missions.name: Roll Call
missions.summary: Contractors investigate plantations and lumber sites to check for undocumented and trafficked workers.

briefing.mission:
We are tasked with checking several sites for the presence of workers that have not been registered with the authorities.

Any workers found are to be detained and taken back to our base for further processing. Government officials will pick up the workers from our base.
We are to detain the land owners if undocumented workers are found on their property. They will be collected by the HIL.

We are to be aware that the workers may be under duress and not want to cooperate, we need to ensure we operate efficiently and are able to gain their cooperation.

The traffickers will likely not be present at the sites, but they may be contacted by the land owners.
We need to operate quickly to ensure the traffickers can not get to the sites before us and remove the workers.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Detain any undocumented personnel working on the sites
- Detain land owners that have undocumented personnel working on their property
- Prevent the traffickers from removing the undocumented personnel from the sites, or otherwise interfering

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Collect any evidence of the trafficking operation
briefing.situation:
Tanoa's rising industrial sector has been stagnating in recent years as the Tanoan population is not large enough to sustain the growth on its own.

As a result, a human trafficking problem has been growing in the region.
The local Tanoa government had previously been turning a blind eye to the problem, as the traffickers are paying them off.
However, the situation has gotten out of hand, and the Horizon Islands Government has begun to crack down on the traffickers.
The small Horizon Islands Legion is not suited for such operations, and have requested the expertise of Synixe Contractors.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Horizon Islands Government

Runs the country of which Tanoa is just one region, the local levels of the Tanoan government are corrupt and ineffective.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Traffickers and Hired Mercenaries
Location: Tanoan Islands

The traffickers are a loose coalition of criminal organizations, and are well funded.
They have a firm grip on several members of local government, and have hired mercenaries to protect their operations.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Horizon Islands Legion
Location: Various small outposts around Tanoa

The HIL is a small and inexperienced military force, and is not suited for the task of dealing with the traffickers.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians in the region have varying opinions on the traffickers.
Some have been paid off, some are upset about the lowering of wages as a result of the traffickers importing cheap labor.
Some are upset about the human rights violations, and some are just upset about the increased crime rate.
Fear of the traffickers is common, as they are known to be retaliatory against those who speak out against them.

missions.name: Roughing It
missions.summary: Contractors must track men delivering supplies to a hidden outpost, and destroy it

briefing.mission:
An armed group working for the traffickers have been operating an outpost near the town of Harcourt.

Thanks to an inside source at the Harcourt docks, we know that a shipment of their supplies have arrived and will be transported to the outpost today.

Follow the men taking the supplies to the outpost, and destroy the outpost.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Destroy the outpost.
- Rescue any victims that are around.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Note down any evidence for the HIL.

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
Ensure there is no fighting in Harcourt, if you are engaged, disengage and avoid a firefight in the town.

missions.name: Undeliverable
missions.summary: Contractors must intercept airdropped supplies before the enemy can hide them.

briefing.mission:
The Russo-Lybor Separtists are preparing to receive a shipment of weapons from Russia.

We know they receive them via airdrop in the northern mountains, but we don't know the exact location.

Some possible locations have been marked in red, along with some known camp locations they've used in the past in yellow.

Intercept as many of the supplies as you can, take anything back to your base as you can, destroy the rest.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Intercept and secure the weapons shipment, or destroy it if you cannot secure it.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Disrupt any enemy camps you encounter

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
The use of a UAV may appear on the instruments of the aircraft performing the drop.
It is highly advised not to use a UAV until you are certain the drop has been made.

missions.name: Walk in the Park
missions.summary: Contractors deliver supplies to farmsteaders, hoping to gain some intel and support from the armed locals.

briefing.mission:
A family on the farmstead at 062046 was recently extracted from the area. They were providing information to the Government about the separatists movements, but a corrupt politician sold them out and 2 of the 3 sons were killed as contractors failed to extract them all in time.

The Armed Civilians, most of whom live on such farmsteads, have been thus far neutral in the conflict, only concerned with defending their homes and families.

The Government would like to curry favour with them, and has asked us to provide them with some supplies to help them defend themselves. Hopefully swaying them to provide more information to the Government again.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Deliver the supplies to the 8 farmsteads marked on the map.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
Assist the Armed Civilians with any tasks or tips they may have for you.

Engage any Separatist forces you encounter, especially near the farmsteads.

missions.name: Burning Man
missions.summary: Rescue a United Assistance officer being held hostage by insurgents

briefing.mission:
A UA officer -Noah Walker- is believed to have been kidnapped by the Anizay Freedom Insurgency three hours ago at 0400. The Anizay Militia has been stretched thin and has been unable to assist with CSAR (Combat Search and Rescue) operations. The latest intel puts him in somewhere in Zaranj, Musakhan, or Khas.

Synixe has been tasked with conducting CSAR operations to rescue the UA officer, and bringing him back to your FOB where the UA will coordinate pickup.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
Locate the officer, Noah Walker, and return him to your FOB.

missions.name: Break On Through
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with retaking industrial sites.

briefing.mission:
Recently the Russo-Lyborian Separatists took over two industrial sites to the west of the region and are believed to be using them as staging points for further incursions into tows.

Synixe has been tasked with moving into and clearing the industrial sites, destroying any supplies that the enemies may have been gathering along the way.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Retake the industrial sites occupied by the enemy.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Destroy any supply caches you may find

missions.name: Green Hell
missions.summary: Contractors find and destroy communications outposts.

briefing.mission:
SIGINT has revealed that the enemy has recently set up communications outposts in Sosovu and Yasa islands.

Synixe has been tasked to move into the islands and find and destroy any comms outposts that are found.

As always rescue any victims that are found in the AO and secure and note down evidence for the HIL.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Find and destroy any communications outposts in the islands
- Rescue any victims that are in the area

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Note down any evidence for the HIL.

missions.name: Island In The Sun
missions.summary: Contractors assault an enemy island used as a trafficking hub.

briefing.mission:
Recently a confidential source came forward to media outlets that Ravi-ta Island is being used by the traffickers as a place where victims are taken so that clients can engage in whatever debauchery they desire.

Synixe has been hired to move into the island, gain control of it and rescue any victims that they may find.

The island consists of a main compound, a set of barracks for the guards and a supply depot with some small docks. It has been confirmed as well that island to the west of Ravi-ta is being used as hunting grounds where people are hunted for sport.

Should you find any evidence or POIs, they should be gathered and detained respectively.

<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Take over the Island
- Rescue any hostages that are found

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>

missions.name: Live Wire
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with finding and destroying supply caches

briefing.mission:
Recently the D.O.S has recieved a tip from the AM that the AFI has been stockpiling weapons and vehicles in an area to the south of the region.

Due to this we have been tasked with moving into the area and destroying any supply caches that we find.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Search the area and destroy any supply caches you find
briefing.situation:
A socio-economical crisis has been brewing in the region of Anizay, and as a result, a civil war ensued. NATO had been assisting its allies and associates in evacuations in the weeks leading up to the major pullout, but now all that is left is some remnants of a few UNA forces still stationed at FOB Nauzad and FOB Obeh, while those who missed the evacuations have been left behind scrambling for a way to escape. As of recently the insurgency has proven to be a force to be reckoned with after carrying out several succesful attacks against the military detachments present in the region. As civilians scrambled to evacuate, insurgents made sure to attack Landay airfield in an attempt to hold as many of the population within the region as bargaining chips. In response to this, humanitarian efforts and foreign military involvement has quickly escalated prominently.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
United States Department of State

The United States Department of State has outsourced its security operations to Synixe Contractors due to a limitation in jurisdictions for certain operations.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Anizay Freedom Insurgency

The Anizay Freedom Insurgency has been trying to gain leverage over both national and international sources in an attempt to counter many new foreign relations and reforms in Anizay, as such, they have taken to violence as a means to promote their message and pursue a revolution, having started to go after some notorious VIPs in the region of Anizay who have been left behind during the NATO pullout, and subsequently, the start of UNA's recess in the region.

They are often seen wearing robes and turbans, and seem to be equipped with surplus equipment consisting of small arms and some statics.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
United Assistance (UNA)
Location(s): FOB Nauzad, FOB Obeh

United Assistance has been in charge of peacekeeping operations in Anizay. As of recent events, both their resources and efforts have diminished, and their evacuation operations have ceased, leading up to Synixe Contractors involvement.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Anizay Militia

The Anizay Militia has been at war with the Anizay Freedom Insurgency ever since the discontent in the region reached its boiling point. They have access to armored vehicles and military equipment previously provided by other foreign nations in support of the ongoing course of Anizay, and they are often seen wearing helmets, uniforms, and military garments.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present in the area and may or may not be in support of either Synixe Contractors, UNA, Anizay Militia, or the Anizay Freedom Insurgency.

missions.name: Main Offender
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with hunting down an HVT

briefing.mission:
Recently the KDF found out that one of the main individuals behind the Separatists operations is in an area south of Nozyba.

Synixe has been tasked with moving into this area and hunting down said individual. Although his name is unknown he is famed for his usage of a tracksuit and aviators.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Hunt down the HVT
briefing.situation:
After the latest elections in Korsac the losing side decided to take up arms in an attempt to topple the winning government and take power for themselves.
Since the local defense forces are having trouble suppressing this rebellion, Synixe has been hired to perform COIN (Counter Insurgency) operations in the region in order to aid the winning government.

Terrain considerations: Korsac is a mostly flat area that possesses a mix of lush forests and open plains.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Korsac Government

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Korsac Separatists

Interested in toppling the current government and gaining power. They posses a mix of modern and old Russian weaponry and opt for carrier rigs instead of vests.
They use a myriad of vehicles and are known to have access to tanks and helicopters.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Korsac Defense Force
Location: Comms Ekho

They use modern Russian weaponry and modular carriers for protection. They have a wide array of vehicles ranging from Tanks to Helicopters.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Korsac Armed Locals

A group of locals not allied with either side and just interested in protecting their property. They carry old weapons they already had at their disposal.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians are present throughout the AO.

missions.name: Sat By The Ocean
missions.summary: Contractors do a raid on a location where victims are brought in.

briefing.mission:
Recently an inside man in the trafficking circle has revealed that the Georgetown docks have long been used to bring in trafficking victims via shipping containers.

Synixe has been tasked with assaulting the docks and securing any victims that may be found. We have also been asked to note down any evidence that we see.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Assault the Georgetown docks.
- Rescue any victims that are around.

<font color='#595305'>SECONDARY</font>
- Note down any evidence for the HIL.
briefing.situation:
Tanoa's rising industrial sector has been stagnating in recent years as the Tanoan population is not large enough to sustain the growth on its own.

As a result, a human trafficking problem has been growing in the region.
The local Tanoa government had previously been turning a blind eye to the problem, as the traffickers are paying them off.
However, the situation has gotten out of hand, and the Horizon Islands Government has begun to crack down on the traffickers.
The small Horizon Islands Legion is not suited for such operations, and have requested the expertise of Synixe Contractors.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Horizon Islands Government

Runs the country of which Tanoa is just one region, the local levels of the Tanoan government are corrupt and ineffective.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Traffickers and Hired Mercenaries
Location: Tanoan Islands

The traffickers are a loose coalition of criminal organizations, and are well funded.
They have a firm grip on several members of local government, and have hired mercenaries to protect their operations.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Horizon Islands Legion
Location: Various small outposts around Tanoa

The HIL is a small and inexperienced military force, and is not suited for the task of dealing with the traffickers.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Civilians in the region have varying opinions on the traffickers.
Some have been paid off, some are upset about the lowering of wages as a result of the traffickers importing cheap labor.
Some are upset about the human rights violations, and some are just upset about the increased crime rate.
Fear of the traffickers is common, as they are known to be retaliatory against those who speak out against them.

missions.name: Smoke And Mirrors
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with recovering vital industrial sites

briefing.mission:
Recently the Separatists have taken over several vital industrial sites on the North West. These sites include but are not limited to a large oil refinery used to obtain fuel to power the many homes in Korsac.

Since this facilities are so importants contractors have been tasked with moving into the area and clearing it of any occupying forces in order to return back to their rightful owners.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Clear all the industrial sites.

missions.name: Stick Up
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with clearing camps and destroying supplies

briefing.mission:
A member of the Korsac Armed Locals was walking around an area in the North East of the region when he spotted a group of Separatists gathered around a campfire.

Further surveillance of the area has revealed that the KS have been setting up camps in the area and using them to safeguard supplies ranging from weapons to ammunition.

Contractors must move into the area and clear any enemy camps that they find, destroyin whatever supply caches they find along the way.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Clear any enemy camps you find
- Destroy any supply caches you find

missions.name: Trapdoor Solution
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with delivering supplies

briefing.mission:
After the botched evacuation and due to AFI using civilians as bargaining chips our employer has decided to deliver food and medical supplies to several towns in order to both boost public perception and help the civilians that are trapped.

It has been decided that the towns that will be receiving the aid are Khas, Seyyedan and Salam. The supplies will be picked up FOB Nauzad, they will be waiting for you near the main entrance.

Should you encounter any enemy presence, it must be neutralized in order to weaken the AFI.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Deliver two boxes of food and two boxes of medical supplies to Salam.
- Deliver three boxes of food and three boxes of medical supplies to Seyyedan.
- Deliver four boxes of food and four boxes of medical supplies to Khas.
- Clear any enemy presence you encounter.

<font color='#E3D310'>RESTRICTIONS</font>
- The boxes in Salam must be dropped off in a compound that has a shed next to it's main building.
- The boxes in Seyyedan must be dropped off at the three story building.
- The boxes in Khas must be dropped off at the Mosque which will be guarded by the Anizay Militia, supplies are to be delivered to the AM team leader.

missions.name: Two Kinds Of Trouble
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with protecting foreign interests in the region

briefing.mission:
Recently the RLS have ramped up their efforts in disrupting foreign interests in the region. They have taken over several important sites on the south of the region and it is believed that they are going to destroy them.

Syinxe has been tasked with moving into the area, making sure that the sites are safe and disarming any explosives that the RLS may have planted in them.
briefing.objectives:
<font color='#E3D310'>PRIMARY</font>
- Make sure that any infrastructure to the south is safe
briefing.situation:
Lybor has seen a rise in violence over the past few months.

Synixe has been contracted to combat the cell near the town of Kinney.

<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Lybor Government

The Lybor Government has been ramping up its efforts to combat rising extremists.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Russo-Lyborian Separatists
Location: Throughout Lybor

The Russo-Lyborian Separatists are a group of extremists that wish to see Lybor embrace Russian influence.
They have been known to use IEDs, VBIEDs, and other explosives to attack Lyborian Government forces.
They are outfitted with the latest Russian equipment and employ guerrilla tactics.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
The majority of civilians in the area do not support the Russo-Lyborian Separatists.
While some may have a friendly view of Russia, they do not support the rise in violence.
